alert.note: Alert for Bolivar; Sunflower (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 6:18PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sunflower and east central Bolivar Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 618 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mound Bayou, or near Shelby, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rome around 635 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Winstonville and Merigold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
